item.title: Introducing Vector Buckets
item.description: ğŸš€ Exciting news from Supabase! They have launched Vector Buckets, a new storage option that combines durability with built-in similarity search. This feature offers an efficient way to manage large datasets, catering to modern app needs like semantic search and recommendations. You can now choose between pgvector for smaller datasets or Vector Buckets for storing millions of vectors seamlessly. Explore the potential of Vector Buckets today! ğŸŒğŸ” #Supabase #VectorStorage…

item.title: Supabase Launch Week 15 Hackathon Winner Announcement
item.description: ğŸš€ Supabase Launch Week 15 has concluded, and we are excited to announce the winners of our Hackathon! The event showcased remarkable innovation from participants, demonstrating their technical skills. The standout project, “Figma AI Tickets” by vickywane, is a plugin that converts design tasks into actionable user stories using OpenAIâ€™s GPT-4. Congratulations to all participants for their impressive submissions! ğŸ‘ #Supabase #Hackathon #Innovation #Figma #GPT4

item.title: Supabase Auth: Build vs. Buy
item.description: ğŸ” Understanding authentication is key for developers. While itâ€™s essential in almost every app, it’s often not the main focus. Supabase Auth provides a ready-made solution, integrating directly with your Postgres database. It offers JWT-based security and seamless Row Level Security integration. Building your own authentication can lead to hidden costs, such as time and maintenance, which can divert resources from core development. Consider your options carefully! ğŸ”’ğŸ’» #Supabase #Authentication…
